website_summaries.verdict: With an amazing variety of discs, this anodized aluminum and steel press gives you flawless, professional results with everything from sugar and spritz cookies to cheese straws.
pros: Rugged construction from steel and anodized aluminum
Easy to take apart and wash by hand
cons: The plunger that pushes the dough forward may fail over time

customer_reviews.title: Marcato 0801 vs Pampered Chef Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: The Marcato 0801 works 100% better than the Pampered Chef cookie press. I had no idea that a cookie press could work like this. I should of retired my Pampered Chef years ago. I used the PC Spritz recipe & it works perfect in the Marcato. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because the barrel is smaller so not that much dough can be inserted. However, this product works so efficient that replacing the dough is easy. I would recommend the purchase of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa

customer_reviews.title: I got it as a Christmas gift--after grumbling for the 10th year in a row how I HATE my two old presses when it was cookie-baking
customer_reviews.text: I hardly ever write reviews but I had to rave about this cookie press. I got it as a Christmas gift--after grumbling for the 10th year in a row how I HATE my two old presses when it was cookie-baking time a few weeks ago. Whipped up some butter cookies last night. By FAR this was the easiest press to use. I was done in no time. I tried different disks, and all were cute and even. It seems like a study construction, too. I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: USED ITEM RECEIVED with rotton dough still inside!!
customer_reviews.text: Received used item! Rusted plunger rod - how is that possible for food grade steel? that too under conditions with no high temp or high pressure! Seems this is NOT food grade steel!! Further, there was dough inside smelling bad!! This is so disgusting! and could be a health hazard! The discs had marks on them of use. Item was received 12 days after order placement. I say this does not deserve the price tag with the quality of product i received while there are tons available on amazon with all stainless steel construction.
customer_reviews.author: dipti

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it had a good recommendation from America's Test Kitchen, however it is not working for me. I had no problem assembling it properly but once I get dough in it, the process quickly went downhill. Cookies will not release. I watched several online videos to try to troubleshoot. The main thing I notice is that the range of motion for operation of the lever is much greater in the videos than what I'm getting. My lever moves only minimally. I worked with this for about 90 minutes. This produced just 4 items that resembled a cookie. Very disappointed not to get better results. I had high hopes but will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best In Class
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to spend this much, but it's worth it. Beautifully made. *Slightly* tricky to figure our operation, but nearly flawless once you do (and not really that hard). I actually ordered this because it had the center ribbon fitting by which you can make your own shapes or letters. As my mother always did with her old Mirro for Spritz cookies. MUCH easier to use the other shapes! So beautiful I'll have to give some away. Thank you, Marcato & Italian engineering!
customer_reviews.author: Bartles

customer_reviews.title: Chill your cookie sheets!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product for making my grandmother's Italian lemon/anise cookies. The texture of the cookies came out just as it is meant to. To get the batter to stick to the sheet properly, you really do have to chill the cookie sheet. I was making a large batch to give some as gifts so I rotated my pans through the freezer, doing a quick blast in between. This worked! Easy to clean and use.
customer_reviews.author: JennLP

customer_reviews.title: OH, MY GOODNESS!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time today to make chocolate spritz for my husband - trying a new recipe in a new cookie press could have been a mess. This wasn't. My dough was a little sticky, but soft, and it went through the various disks like a dream. Clean-up was super easy. Everything about this press is easy. It's well made, and pretty, too. I'm so glad I decided to get a new cookie press when my really old electric cookie press just didn't cut it this past Christmas. I would recommend watching the Mercato video when you first start...it helped me a lot, though I did not use their recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: After a bit of trial and error on my part, this Cookie Press is the best one I've ever used. I usually put parchment paper on my cookie sheets to bake my cookies. Using the parchment paper didn't work for me using a Spritz cookie recipe with this cookie press. Once I removed the parchment paper and double-checked the operation of the cookie press it worked great! I wished I had larger cookie sheets and a larger oven because this cookie press can pump out cookie dough like magic!
customer_reviews.author: BooBooBaby

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Sure it's pricey. But it works. I've tried several other low-cost plastic models, and they just don't do a good job. This one makes consistent cookies every time without having to bear down on the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: BlueD

customer_reviews.title: Only 2 years old and already doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first cookie press in the early 1980s and it lasted until 2016. I then bought this product which lasted exactly 2 years. The little metal piece that locks into the teeth of the press has worn out and bent, so that now it no longer presses out the dough. And it's only been used for holiday cookies in 2016 and 2017. A big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this cookie press after our Wilton cookie press died. I really like the quality of the cookie press and the ease of use. We made two different batches of cookies using three different cookie designs. The design plates were easy to change, the press was easy to use even for my 10 year old daughter and best of all it was easy to take apart and clean. Although this press is more expensive than the Wilton press, I would highly recommend the splurge. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because of the higher price, but decide to try it because it looked like a solid unit. IT is SOLID. It is easy to use & clean (the bottom & top ring screw off to access the tube). It came with 20 design disks that are beautiful & a lever to adjust how much dough comes our per cookie. The dough dispensed easily & uniformly. I really was very impressed with the quality & performance. WELL worth the price. I no longer dread making butter cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline W. Dager

customer_reviews.title: It crossthreads and doesn’t come apart for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if this is a defective one, but it crossthreads when you press out cookies and doesn’t come apart easily for cleaning when it crossthreads. In fact I can’t get it apart at all anymore and I only made cookies twice! It’s two months old and company will not respond to my 4 emails over 2 weeks
customer_reviews.author: jcb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought so many cheap cookie presses and I decided to splurge and buy a good one. This is a remarkable cookie press. I even did shortbread in it. Solid awesome construction. Definitely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. I wasn’t sure since my strength isn’t as good as it used to be,but it is no problem to work this press. Works great! Better than the other company that start with a W. My grandkiddos can even do it
customer_reviews.author: Hertdog1

customer_reviews.title: Broke upon first use.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife, she loved it, until it broke on its first use! The ratchet mechanism failed and a chunk of metal broke off of it. My wife had a plastic one before this that lasted longer and cost a quarter of the money
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If you have hand strength issues this is still very easy to use. High altitude baking is always a challenge. I did not use the recipe included, used a recipe with cream cheese instead. I'm very happy with the variety of shapes available and appreciate that there are so many choices. Easy to store. I hand wash mine just because.
customer_reviews.author: Pa

customer_reviews.title: which is easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: A very well made "cookie press", which is easy to assemble, unassemble, and clean. It is made of aluminum and is more heavy duty than most "presses" I have seen. It doesn't hold as much dough as I would have liked, but then it holds the same amount as most similar presses. There is an adjustment lever that allows you to make 2 sizes of cookies - small and larger. I think it will be durable enough to last for years and years, something that can't be said for ones made of plastic. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: francisdrew

customer_reviews.title: The Lamborghini of Biscuit Machines!
customer_reviews.text: The Marcato Biscuits Machine is the Lamborghini of cookie machines. I have tried every machine available in my quest to make my families favorite Spritz cookies. Every time I tried I ended up mad and exhausted from the inconsistency of the all the different cheesy machines. I am in love with the Marcato! My only suggestion is to include a plunger to stuff the dough into the cylinder. It’s not unlike stuffing s cannon ball down a cannon. Doing this removes air pockets and makes a very consistent cookie. I made my own out of one of my old, cheap cookie machines.
customer_reviews.author: Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Good but it rusts
customer_reviews.text: After a first use, I just left over night in water for cleaning. In the morning, I found it it started to rust just from water. I’m disappointed and I wished it was durable. I though buying a more expensive one like this would be more durable than cheap plastic ones. But it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I first bought an OXO spritz cookie press and struggled to get the plunger to engage. So I did some research and this item was highly rated. The reviews were right! It was so easy to use. Once I got the hang of it, the cookies were consistent size. The unit was easy to clean. The only thing I noticed is that I didn't yield as many cookies as the recipe said - guess I made the cookies too big. I look forward to trying more designs. This might be my new wedding cookie addition!
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Standing by the Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Marcoto Biscuit maker in Sept. Didn't use it until last week to make Christmas cookies. It did not function properly. It worked, but not correctly. I think if it worked properly it would be great. That's why only three stars. So I emailed Amazon, Great Household who was the shipper, and Marcato. Low and behold after proving my purchase, Harold Import sent me a brand new machine. Haven't used it yet, but couldn't be happier. After all these months, my purchase was honored with limited difficulty. Kudos to all of you.
customer_reviews.author: James Vafiadou, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I've been making spritz cookies all my life and I've used several different cookie presses and this one is the best. It is well made and much easier to use than all the others I have tried. Its a bit more expensive but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Professional results.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very sturdy device. I have made several different type of cookies with it and find that the results are very professional. Although, it is quite expensive. However, if you are looking for professional results you won't go wrong with this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: T. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Too Complicated to Use
customer_reviews.text: It was very difficult to unscrew coming out of the package. Then when I made cookies, the directions were very unclear and I was unable to figure out how to operate. I was unable to use it for my cookies. Previously I had the OXO which was much simpler to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: Metal construction and easy to use. I really like this press. I wish it held more dough than it does, but that just gives me a reason to make sure I have a variety of shapes because I can change the disc more often.
customer_reviews.author: Slippednfell

customer_reviews.title: Love it, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love it, sturdy, makes great cookies, shapes are nice. Don't waste time on the plastic versions, they break and cookie quality is poor, and messy.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Best Cookie Press!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the Best cookie press ever! I have owned and broken my share of different cookie press’ over the last year! This one is way more sturdy as there are very little plastic parts in it. It has a setting for different dough amount per press and is easy to clean! I know this one is more pricey but worth every penny if you are serious about your pressed cookies!
customer_reviews.author: Herdis A.

customer_reviews.title: Last cookie press you will buy
customer_reviews.text: The price of this cookie press is steep, bit if I add up the cost of the 20 presses I dumped over the years as being useless, this press is a bargain. Perfect cookies every time. Well worth the investment. I make thousands of cookies every Christmas as gifts and this press made my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Marie

customer_reviews.title: Wow factor.!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am totally amazed, great tool. I do not bake cookies. I wanted for churros, is a very hard dough, but it did a great Job! the price, better yet! I will bay another one for my friend Thank you a lot. great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gibelli

customer_reviews.title: Quality press
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality press. It takes some training to get the prefect press with this. It's a great device and surely made from quality materials that will last. We only had a problem trying to figure out the correct settings to get the right amount of dough from each press. More than likely operator error that will take some trial and error. Over all happy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Quality Cookie Press!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for making Danish vanilla wreath cookies. It pressed a rope of dough through the star shape perfectly! This machine is easy to use, easy to clean, and built to last! I'm so glad, because I plan to put it to lots of use!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: If you want a truly high quality cookie press, this is the way to go. Metal parts where it matters and it doesn't break like all of the cheap plastic ones you see at a lower price range. These can get pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for when it comes it. Hands down the best one on the market that I have ever owned. 10/10 would recommend Marcato Cookie Press over any of the cheap plastic things. Only con (which isn't really a con) is that the discs are a bit thinner than ones in the past, but I have never had one bend or anything crazy so I guess it doesn't even matter.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Definite learning curve
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this but it's very inconsistent. I am a skilled baker and have watched the Marcato video many times, but I still have trouble with the cookies being consistent. Sometimes they're the perfect size, sometimes they come out too big or too small - in the same batch that's in the press. I'm giving myself a break from the frustration and will try to master it again later.
customer_reviews.author: Francisca A.

customer_reviews.title: make the adjustment to change size of cookie. It does not lock in for the size you need
customer_reviews.text: I have used many recipes and this machine just smashes the dough. Very disappointed. Returned one already and this one is the same, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Anne P. Manganelli

customer_reviews.title: Lovely product but take time to study the directions
customer_reviews.text: I am remarkably all thumbs when it comes to figuring out how things go together to make them work. Directions were a bit sketchy but I did finally figure it out. Made spritz cookies for the first time in a couple years (delicious). Well made sturdy cookie press. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Knitting Granny

customer_reviews.title: Makes a rookie cookie baker feel like a pro!
customer_reviews.text: Having a never made shaped cookies before, apart from sugar cookies with a cutter, I thought I would give this a try. It is a simple device that is made and works well, and the cookies it produces are flawless. I would highly recommend the Marcato to those with little or much experience in the shaped cookie arena!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Awwsum
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product to use in kitchen for all types of cookies Comes with additional shape blades Beautiful
customer_reviews.author: RICKY

customer_reviews.title: Takes practice
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use this product...thought it would replace my aged manual screw-type cookie maker for my spritz cookies. I am keeping it but, honestly, I gave up on it for this year. I tried dough in several stages...too soft, too hard, just right. It is very hard to figure out the right consistency dough for this press. Once I figure that out I will love it. I do love the way the press works (the handle thingy)..very comfortable to use. I suspect it works best using their recipes; however, their recipes are in grams and I didn't know how to convert accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like the color and how well made this press is. I had no problem pressing cookies. Very glad I purchased. I like that it is made in italy, and not the usual answer... china.
customer_reviews.author: Kjo44

customer_reviews.title: Good manual biscuit/cookie press
customer_reviews.text: Appearance: excellent, Good Quality, There was a bit of a learning curve—once I got the hang of it —works fine. I like the idea that you can make small or large biscuits. Good purchase- I just wished they had the Green unit.
customer_reviews.author: D Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Worked good, had a little issue with it releasing the dough but maybe it was the consistency of it. Overall was able to use with no major issues.
customer_reviews.author: MAARRIA

customer_reviews.title: If it's a Marcato it must be good
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to make pressed cookies (Spritz) in the past and made a huge mess - finally gave my cookie press away. The Marcato cookie press appealed to me for its sleek look and its pedigree. I have a Marcato ravioli press and have appreciated how well made it is. As I just received my cookie press this week I haven't had the chance to use it, but I am looking forward to some yummy cookies without the mess of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Herrmann

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for frosting
customer_reviews.text: Giving it 3 stars because it looks like it works well, but didn’t work for my cookie dough. I imagine it would work for a certain dough which is super soft, closer to frosting (the dough I was working with was soft and light as well, but I guess not enough)
customer_reviews.author: Shiran

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: This press handles the stiffest shortbread dough without massive pain. I am a senior citizen and used this press to make hundreds of cookies, easily. Easier than my old electric press.
customer_reviews.author: paul d. howell

customer_reviews.title: More sturdy than most
customer_reviews.text: This is likely the 5th gun I’ve had. In fact, I think I had this one before. I’ve learned you need to know the temperature “approx” where your dough is going to flow out of the gun. It’s not the same with all the die. Also, don’t pack the tube more than 3/4 full.
customer_reviews.author: Wanting What I Paid For

customer_reviews.title: Performed very well!
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased many many many cookie presses in the past and they basically only held up for the one use for christmas cookies. This press performed very well and made consistent shaped cookies. Had purchased 2 and pleasantly surprised not to have used the “back up”
customer_reviews.author: Bunkie

customer_reviews.title: Happy Grandma
customer_reviews.text: Easy for my granddaughter to use. We had a wonderful time making cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Mary O.

customer_reviews.title: A reliable cookie press
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the perfomance and quality of the Norpro 3301 cookie press. Each year we bake the family recipe for German spritz cookies. Other presses I have used were a pain in the neck to use either because the manual racheting system slipped or in the case of an electric machine, it was more trouble than it was worth. Both ended up in the trash after one Christmas. This little press was straightforward and easy to fill and use. The Norpro has a metal mechanism and metal disks, which were sturdy and easy to clean. The cookies formed easily, and tasted great! I'm this press will make great "spritzgeback" for years to come! Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Lin Lichtenberg

customer_reviews.title: Make cookies like your Nona used to
customer_reviews.text: I am happy I purchased the Marcado Press. It is sturdy without being heavy and it is easy to clean. It is the Cadillac of Cookie Presses. All ready I have someone who is begging to borrow it. Cannot wait to get going on my Christmas Cookies. Only wish they had a nice little recipe book with a selection on "Italian Biscuits" Directions who had one basic recipe.
customer_reviews.author: jean sarnie

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best cookie press ever...
customer_reviews.text: And I have tried quite a few. Every year we make around 1000 butter cookies. What I like about this press is that it easily knocks out uniform perfectly shaped cookies. Once in awhile I have issue with the first cookie out of the barrel but once you find your groove it is smooth sailing.
customer_reviews.author: Susan F.

customer_reviews.title: ... inexpensive cookie presses over the years and they always disappoint. Decided I would invest in a better one ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had the inexpensive cookie presses over the years and they always disappoint. Decided I would invest in a better one and it has really paid off! Easy to use/ easy to clean . Well worth the investment. Follows that famous saying "'you get what u pay for" Bobby
customer_reviews.author: Bobby !

customer_reviews.title: BEST COOKIE PRESS EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I spent the extra money for this!! I had previously used Wilton, but they’re so flimsy they really don’t last long. This one is made of much sturdier components and actually work as easily as it says. It took me no time at all to make the cookies. In the two days I’ve had this I’ve told everyone they need to get one!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Smith

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.  Beware of Warning Label on Product
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the good reviews of this product. There is a warning label about lead and other cancer causing chemicals with this product. The edges are razor sharp, cut right out of the box. Very difficult to work with. Not good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome is all that needs to be said.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I use it to make cheese rings and it is awesome. I do recommend it to anyone who makes allot of cookies or cheese rings,you won't be disappointed. So precise, doesn't make your hands tired while using it, easy to fill up and easy to clean. I give it a 10+
customer_reviews.author: Janice Thompson

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased so many cookie presses over the years, and they have all failed me. I was ready to give up, and my husband loves this brand, so he told me to purchase this brand cookie press. This is THE BEST COOKIE PRESS I have ever purchased!!! Easy to use, easy to clean! The cookies came out great!!!!
customer_reviews.author: dezertgem

customer_reviews.title: You have got be strong to press the cookies out.
customer_reviews.text: The recipes do not tell you that the dough has be cold. Even when the dough is cold it’s very difficult to press the cookies out, You need a lot of strength, my husband helped. Bad recipes, difficult to understand.
customer_reviews.author: shoe princess

customer_reviews.title: Pretty as its picture, until you wash it.
customer_reviews.text: The finish became marred after going through the dishwasher the very first time. Very disappointing, particularly at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Silberman

customer_reviews.title: Made of metal!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m impressed by the quality and being almost all metal. I had hopes of using it for cookies with mini chocolate chips, but they weren’t small enough to push through the holes. I will be finding a few other things to put through it though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Moser

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little spritzer!
customer_reviews.text: Totally awesome. My spritzer looks a little different than the photo in that the whole body is silver, but it works fabulously. I made cookies with it and had no problems whatsoever. The dough pressed through easily and made perfect cookies right off the bat. The spritzer is easy to squeeze and the cookies are uniform. Cleanup is easy and there are lots of shapes to choose from. You'll be happy with this item!
customer_reviews.author: Prairiemom

customer_reviews.title: Add to your cart now!
customer_reviews.text: I love using this cookie press! Made heart shaped cheese straws for my niece’s wedding and they were a huge hit! Made square shaped one’s too. Cookies were fun and easy to make as well. Can’t wait to make Christmas cookies. Sturdy, easy to use, clean up is a breeze. I highly recommend this cookie press.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Really good cookie pusher!
customer_reviews.text: I asked my family to give this to me for Christmas as all the reviews (not just from Amazon.com) were great. It is metal (not plastic). It has 20 discs. It goes together solidly and it delivers crisp edges to the designs.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this cookie press!
customer_reviews.text: This cookie press is awesome! All metal parts and makes a very nice cookie. I look forward to using this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: cjh

customer_reviews.title: ... have had many cookie presses and this is the best one by far
customer_reviews.text: I have had many cookie presses and this is the best one by far. It holds less dough so you have to stop more often to fill it up but other than that I am most happy with this. Beautifully made, almost like a piece of art!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutley love this biscuit maker. Had to make a huge batch of cheese straws and it performed beautifully and clean up was a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Cookie press
customer_reviews.text: We made some cookies when we got it. It was totally easier than our other cookie press. It is easier and cleaned up supper nice.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great for cheesesteaks as well as cookies
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize when I ordered it that it was the same brand I already had, which I'd worn out through long use. Instructions don't make obvious, though, that the result of the head for shaping cheesestraws ("sticks") is quite different from anything shown in the brochure. I almost didn't't order it because I wasn't sure it was going to give me what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Consumer

customer_reviews.title: love this press
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for an all metal press for a while now. I've found a few others that were mostly metal but not with the parts that mattered. This press is mostly metal with just a couple pieces made of plastic. The important (stress barring) parts are all metal which makes this press ideal for everyday use. I have finally found my go to press for all of my baking.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L. Young

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had to use it right away. Every cookie turned out perfect. Can't wait to make more.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine934

customer_reviews.title: Blown away
customer_reviews.text: After struggling for years with the cheapie Walmart and pampered chef versions I bought this. Wow! Game changer. Works perfectly with no frustration
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Good but some minus point. Read it full
customer_reviews.text: Cookie Shape - almost 90% accurate if u do it straight directly on pan not on butter sheet. Pressing is very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST cookie press I’ve ever owned. So easy to use. Just perfect. I preferred to use the setting for the smaller cookie as they came out just right. I also followed the directions in the booklet that came with the cookie press, but not the recipe.
customer_reviews.author: missvidaboheme

customer_reviews.title: Broken Plastic Top
customer_reviews.text: Product broken when delivered. The plastic top that the handle attaches to was broken where the handle is rivited to the plastic top. Product returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use cookie press!!
customer_reviews.text: This was quite expensive for a small cookie press (small in how much dough it will hold). BUT- it is amazing!! You can control how much dough comes out to determine the size of the cookie. I love this cookie press- it's well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Malinowski

customer_reviews.title: Best cookie press!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a cookie press for years and every time I buy one, it doesn’t work or it gives me an extremely hard time. This one was AMAZING! It was so so easy to use. Just make sure you read the instructions and that everything is lined up the way it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Justina

customer_reviews.title: Quite compacted, but well made.
customer_reviews.text: Was a lot smaller then I imagined. It will take a lot of reloading to make enough for a real Italian holiday.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow this is the one you want to order. My wife is into
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is the one you want to order. My wife is into baking large amounts of cookies for all occasions. She’s been through four or five other cheaper cookie guns, this is the best quality she has seen yet at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made press
customer_reviews.text: This cookie press was easier to use than the OXO. Also this press has two sizes of cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Lacrosse Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for making spritz cookies
customer_reviews.text: First one I received was defective - it was impossible to disassemble. The second one is perfect. Follow the instructions and don’t use parchment or else the cookies will not detach from the press!
customer_reviews.author: Lillian

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great...very durable, easy cleanup. Not a fan of the booklet that came with it. Used my own recipe for spritz cookies. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Barb H

customer_reviews.title: cookies for X-Mas
customer_reviews.text: Cookies have become my way of celebrating "that" time of year. I refuse to participate in mindless consumerism. That said..this cookie press is easy to use and will last for a long time since most of the pieces are metal. I've had many others which broke mid-formation but I'm confident I'll be making cookie gifts for X-mas for a loong time. I'll probably hand it down to my daughter who I'm grooming to take over the baking.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cookie press
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookie press, its presentation is very elegant, easy to use and they are very beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Willmer Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cookie press.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for, a sturdy and easy to use cookie press for Christmas. Most others are plastic, this appears to actually be made of metal. it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Kilde: it's like "tilde" with a K.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who loves to make spritz cookies. Mine is thin and the disc often dislodges from the pressure. This one is sturdy and makes nicely shaped cookies. My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: roseaubrey

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: Tried tons of cookie presses and this one tops them all!
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Weinrich

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Had to refill after making only one pan. Hard to load. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Cochrane

customer_reviews.title: High quality and beautiful to look at
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had a chance to use it yet, but I’m so excited to try it ! It looks beautiful , seller had fast shipping, and the product is high quality !
customer_reviews.author: Elyse Lentini

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a great product
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet but it looks to be in good working order, included all the patterns of cookie designs I could ever need and arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: DRod

customer_reviews.title: I made cheese straws with this and they were fabulous.
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about this product. Easy to use, clean, and store. Made great cookies and cheese straws. I just tried making the cookies from the book that came with the press. Did not like them or the consistency. Has anyone made butter cookies from another recipe and used this cookie press? I need suggestions. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Jaynell Lindner

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to get the knack but it produces a great cookie but then I guess it depends on the dough you use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down one of the best, easiest to use spritz cookie maker around! It's stainless steel frame allows for dough to release easily, allows for easy clean up and is durable! I easily made 4 dozen cookies in less than 30 minutes and had many, many compliments!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cookies are inconsistant in shape and size.
customer_reviews.text: The cookie press seems to be well made, but the product coming out is not of uniform size and shape, which I feel is the whole reason behind using a cookie press. The other issue is that the barrel is so small that one only gets about a half of a standard cookie sheet filled before the barrel needs to be reloaded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I make several hundred spritz cookies each Christmas season. This press makes the task much easier, from start to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Rigg

customer_reviews.title: Best cookie press on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several, the OXO, the Cuisinart and the Wilton - and while not as easy as I was hoping it would be (ie: automatic, like the Cuisinart), it was consistent and great. It will also clearly last a long time. Well engineered and made. I'd highy recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EpicuriousHeidi

customer_reviews.title: Love this cookie press!
customer_reviews.text: It was a great purchase! Easy to use, easy to figure out, directions easy to read, & easy to clean. Comes with many Cooke shape discs. Cookies came out Great! I must have made 200 CHRISTMAS cookies with this great product the first time! It cost a little more, but I will have it for a very long time! Some others are so flimsy!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Rietta

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely little spritz cookies. Follow the directions, don't try to use parchment paper, the dough needs to cling to the baking pan to work.
customer_reviews.author: beemom

customer_reviews.title: Costs more than most. Worth what I paid for it
customer_reviews.text: I've had my press for 2 years. My old press lasted 35 years, my wife tried to use it for spritz cookies and always had problems (that I didn't) and would not use it. This is great. My wife and children even have no problems making beautiful cookies. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cookie press made
customer_reviews.text: What a product. Wow. Made in italy and made like a Ferarri. This is the easiest press you will ever use and made to last a lifetime. I love this cookie and biscotti press. Great to give as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use for a first -timer like me , easy to clean and lots of disk to change the shape of the cookie! Very well made .
customer_reviews.author: Fmb

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Cant go wrong when majority of the cookie press is metal. Cookies came out great. Will be a handy tool for Christmas cookie bakes.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Miller

product_meta.title: Marcato Atlas Biscuit Maker Press, Made in Italy, Includes 20 Cookie Disc Shapes, Classic Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:Classic SilverMarcato’s Atlas Classic Biscuit Maker makes baking cookies easier and more fun. Simply select desired shape, fill with dough, and press the handle. Nothing tastes better than fresh-baked authentic homemade cookies! This easy-to-use Biscuit Maker, also called a Cookie Press, easily extrudes firm dough, like cookie dough, into many creative shapes. The Biscuit Maker includes 20 discs for traditional cookie shapes and complete instructions. Making that family sugar cookie recipe, or butter cookies, and other cookie press recipes has never been easier. No more rolling or cutting sticky, messy dough. It’s easier and neater than using cookie cutters. Simply remove the top, insert the disc shape, and fill with dough. Each press of the handle advances the dough with a firm, gentle pressure for consistent looking cookies. Disassembles for easy cleaning. Made from anodised aluminum, steel, and ABS. Hand wash in warm, soapy water. Includes a 10-year manufacturer's warranty.

AMAZON.COM
In Europe they call cookies "biscuits," and you can too if you want to lull yourself into thinking you're eating something healthier than sugar cookies. With this Italian biscuit maker, it's easy to get the same size and shape of cookie every time. Just put the dough in the cylinder, choose small or large cookies, attach one of the 20 die-plates, and press the lever; the precise amount of dough is automatically pumped out onto your cookie sheet. Your cookies will look store-bought perfect, but taste oh-so-much-better because you baked them yourself. The maker and die-plates should be hand washed, and they come with a three-year warranty. --Doree Armstrong
feature_bullets: Marcato’s Classic Atlas Biscuit Maker extrudes firm dough into creative shapes for easy cookies and other treats without rolling or cutting dough
Made from anodised aluminum, steel, and ABS; includes 20 traditional cookie disc shapes, complete instructions and 10-year manufacturer’s warranty
Easily adjust cookie sizes from large to small with just the turn of a knob; yields 35 to 40 small cookies and 20 to 25 large cookies
Remove top cover, insert desired cookie disc, fill with dough, replace top and press handle; each press advances dough for consistent looking cookies
Ergonomic design; easier and less messy than cookie cutters; disassembles for cleaning; hand wash in warm, soapy water; available exclusively from HIC
